name: Tulsi (Holy Basil)
habitat: Native to India, grows in tropical and subtropical regions
uses: Boosts immunity, helps with cold & cough, reduces stress, improves digestion
cultivation: Plant in well-drained soil, needs moderate sunlight, water regularly

name: Aloe Vera
habitat: Grows in arid and semi-arid climates worldwide
uses: Soothes skin burns, aids digestion, promotes wound healing, boosts hydration
cultivation: Plant in sandy soil, requires full sun, water sparingly

name: Neem
habitat: Native to India, thrives in tropical and subtropical climates
uses: Antibacterial, antifungal, purifies blood, used in skincare and dental care
cultivation: Prefers sunny locations, grows in well-drained soil with little maintenance

name: Ginger
habitat: Native to Southeast Asia, prefers humid tropical climates
uses: Aids digestion, relieves nausea, reduces inflammation, cures common cold
cultivation: Plant rhizomes in moist soil, partial sunlight, water frequently

name: Ashwagandha
habitat: Native to India and North Africa, prefers dry climates
uses: Boosts stamina, reduces stress, enhances memory, supports immunity
cultivation: Requires sandy soil, dry climate, minimal water, plenty of sunlight

name: Turmeric
habitat: Native to South Asia, thrives in warm and wet regions
uses: Anti-inflammatory, antioxidant, improves skin health, supports digestion
cultivation: Plant rhizomes in rich, moist soil, needs partial sunlight

name: Peppermint
habitat: Native to Europe and the Middle East, cultivated worldwide
uses: Relieves headaches, aids digestion, freshens breath, reduces stress
cultivation: Grows best in moist, shaded soil, needs regular watering

name: Curry Leaves
habitat: Native to India and Sri Lanka, grows in tropical regions
uses: Rich in antioxidants, good for hair and skin, improves digestion
cultivation: Needs well-drained soil, full sun, and regular watering

name: Hibiscus
habitat: Native to Asia and Pacific islands, grows in warm regions
uses: Used in hair care, lowers blood pressure, rich in antioxidants
cultivation: Thrives in warm, sunny climates, requires regular watering

name: Brahmi
habitat: Native to wetlands of India and Southeast Asia
uses: Enhances memory, reduces anxiety, improves concentration
cultivation: Grows in wet, marshy soil with full sunlight
